sen.j: 幕末百話（ばくまつひゃくわ）は、1902年に報知新聞紙上に連載された幕末維新期の回顧談集である。
sen.e: Hundred stories concerning last days of the Tokugawa shogunate are a collection of retrospective stories on the end of the Edo period and Meiji Restoration which appeared serially in Hochi Shinbun (newspaper) in 1902.

sen.j: 古老達よりの聞き取りは記者であった篠田鉱造が行った。
sen.e: A news reporter, Kozo SHINODA, collected the stories from the old men.
A news reporter, Kozo SHINODA, collected the stories from the old men.
A news reporter, Kozo SHINODA, collected the stories from the old men.

sen.j: 談話者は名も無い市井の人々であり、階層・談話内容も多彩である。
sen.e: Those who told the stories were ordinary citizens, and their social classes and stories were various.
Those who told the stories were ordinary citizens, and their social classes and stories are diverse.
sen.cmt: 文末、「were various」の用法が一般的でないように思います。 また、我々から見てこうした人々の階層・談話内容が多彩に見えると考えると、過去形でなく現在形で良いと思います。「varies」としたいところですが、原文では「多彩である」となっていますので、より適切と思われる「diverse」としました。
sen.e: Those who told the stories were ordinary citizens, and their social classes and stories are diverse.

sen.j: 勤番侍が桜田門外の変を語ったかと思うと歌舞伎の道具係が名優を語り、彰義隊残党が敗軍逃亡の有様を語り、御数寄屋坊主が御茶壺道中を語るなど、当事者ならでの実体験に基づく貴重な証言録となっている。
sen.e: They are important records of evidences based on the real experiences, which you only get from the people concerned: For example, kinban zamurai (samurai being on duty in Edo) told the Sakuradamongai Incident; a person in charge of tools told the famous actor; the survivors of Shogitai (group of former Tokugawa retainers opposed to the Meiji government who fought in the Battle of Ueno) told how the defeated army ran away; osukiya bozu (a monk serving the feudal lord in Edo castle) told the tea pot journey.

sen.j: その反面、談話者及び採取日時が明記されていないためそのまま史料とするには注意を要するとの意見もある。
sen.e: On the other hand, the names of discoursers and dates of record were not written, so some people consider that you have to be careful of treating them as historical materials.
